content.description:
SDS with your feet below the pod, and sidepull up into the pod. Come up from the pod, and move up right to a ledge, up left to the next ledge avoiding the extremely friable area, and mantel onto the pod with the small bush growing out of it. Top out, beware of kicking rocks below.

Since this area is on mountain project, I'm assuming this route has already been climbed before. If you have any FA information, please add it to the comments, and I'll update the route information.
content.location: On the East side of the block, on the south side of the wall, look for the obvious pod and small bush on top.

content.description: You start on some slopers and get your feet up so you can dyno to the top out. Beware of flaky rock.
content.protection: A pad or 2, definitely a spotter.
content.location: This route is on the western side of Roog's Wall on the biggest slab.

climbs.name: The Mountains Are Calling, And I Must Go (John Muir)

content.description: This route is a John Muir tribute.
content.protection: One or two pads and a spotter.
content.location: This route is on the western side of Roog's Wall. It has a crack running up it and some pockets on the left side.

content.description: This route is a hard problem to warm up or finish your day on depending on what type of climber you are. You start on a two hand crimp and move up the wall straight then to the left. Beware of flaky rock.
content.protection: You'll want one or two pads and a spotter. If you fall at the top, then you might hit the rock below.
content.location: It is on the right side of the eastern side of the wall. You might see some chalk on the starting hold.

content.description: On the East side of the rock, start on the edge to the upper right of those big ol' bowls, and make your way to the left. The picture doesn't show the length of the rock too well. The holds get progressively harder as you go, but when you get to the end, you can basically just walk off.
content.protection: It has an easy landing - some tall grass and a few rocks. Just watch your ankles.

content.description:
SDS with your feet below the rail at the start and your hands wherever works (lots of sidepulls and ledges to mantel off to start). Follow the crack as close as possible, top out, and walk off the northwest side. Beware of friable rock, and tread carefully, as with the rest of this area.

Since this area has been added to MP, I'm sure this crack has been climbed. Anybody with further FA details, please leave it in the comments.
content.location: On the East side of the rock, follow the faint trail. This is slightly left of middle, you can't miss it.

content.description: This is a fun route that is on a bit of a slab and has lots of little holds.
content.protection: One or two pads and a spotter. You might not want to fall at the top, because this problem is a bit of a highball.
content.location: This route is on the biggest arete on Roog's Wall.
